intro: Phagnalon sordidum, commonly known as the brown starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are usually alternate, linear to lanceolate, and covered in fine pubescence. Phagnalon sordidum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in disturbed or semi-arid environments.
